definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: Then slide the blade out the opposite end.
sentences.chinese: 然後從另一端將刀片滑出。

sentences.english: Xiamen Ground, Xiamen Air 8801, request to taxi.
sentences.chinese: 廈門地面，白鷺8801請求滑出。

sentences.english: The up-and-down movements help obtain a round turn.
sentences.chinese: 身體上下的運動幫助你滑出圓的轉彎。

sentences.english: It also has a slide-out Qwerty keyboard, which is sure to divide opinion.
sentences.chinese: 它還有滑出式全鍵盤，但顯然對這點，人們看法不一。

sentences.english: The truck skidded off the muddy road and turned [over] as it plunged into the canal.
sentences.chinese: 卡車滑出了泥巴路陷入河中的時候翻了過來。

sentences.english: It skidded off the road and hit a big tree.
sentences.chinese: 它滑出路面，撞上一棵大樹。

sentences.english: The dimmable LED light slides out and retracts smoothly with a single touch.
sentences.chinese: 可調LED燈通過單接觸能穩定的滑出和回位。

sentences.english: It'll slide out and ask, "What would you like to play"?
sentences.chinese: 滑出對話框“您想播放什麼？”
我想要一個可滑出的鍵盤。

definition: to slide/to coast/to glide/(of an aircraft) to taxi
to catapult/to launch/to eject (from a plane)/to shoot
(of a meteor etc) to streak across (the sky)/(of a searchlight, lightning etc) to play across (the sky)
to roll/to turn over/to invert/to flip
to shake/to fling one's arm/to lash/to swing
(not of regular commerce) to sell or dispose of (goods etc)/to get rid of/to unload
